text: Fall River is a city in Greenwood County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 131 people lived there. ==History== Fall River was laid out in 1879. It is named after the river it is on, the Fall River. ==Geography== Fall River is at (37.607361, -96.028769). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== Fall River has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Fall River has a humid subtropical climate, shortened to "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Fall River, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== In 2020 census, there were 131 people, 66 households, and 36 families living in Fall River. Of the households, 80.3% owned their home and 19.7% rented their home. The median age was 53.3 years. Of the people, 87.8% were White, 1.5% were Black, 0.8% were Native American, 3.1% were from some other race, and 6.9% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 1.5% of the people. ===2010 census=== In 2010, there were 162 people, 80 households, and 43 families living in Fall River. The population density was . 95.1% of the people were White, 1.2% were Native American, 0.6% were Asian, and 3.1% were from two or more races. 6.8% of the people were Hispanic or Latino of any race. ===2000 census=== In 2000, there were 156 people, 74 households, and 44 families living in Fall River. The population density was 705.6 people per square mile (273.8/km²). ==Famous people== * Johnny Butler, baseball player ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Fall River * Fall River - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 484, local school district ;Maps * Fall River City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Greenwood County, Kansas Category:1879 establishments in Kansas
title: Fall River, Kansas
